greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Self-inverse permutation of the natural numbers based on the bijection (2*x-1)*2^(y-1) <--> (2*y-1)*2^(x-1).
comment: a(a(n)) = n; fixed points A014480: a(A014480(n)) = A014480(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 27 2006
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..6644
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
mathematica: a[n_] := (2 IntegerExponent[2 n, 2] - 1)*2^((n/2^IntegerExponent[n, 2] + 1)/2 - 1); Array[a, 50] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 12 2019 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 24 2006
ext: Spelling corrected by _Jason G. Wurtzel_, Aug 23 2010
